verses.verse: [a] Then Job continued further with his solemn discourse, as he said:
“Oh, how I yearn for the months long gone and for those days when God kept watch over me,
when his lamp continued to shine above my head and by his light I could walk through darkness.
“In those days I was in my prime, and God protected my tent.
The Almighty was ever present at my side, and my children were around me.
My feet were bathed in milk, and the rocks poured forth streams of oil[b] for me.
“When I would go forth to the gate of the city[c] and take my seat in the public square,
the young men would see me and withdraw, and the old men would rise to their feet.
The nobles would refrain from speaking and would place their hands over their mouths.
The voices of the princes were silenced, and their tongues stuck to the roof of their mouths.
“Whoever heard my words spoke favorably of me, and those who saw me testified to my merit,
because I delivered the poor who appealed for help and the orphan who had no one to protect him.
The blessing of the wretched was given to me, and I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.
“I put on righteousness as my garment; justice was my cloak and my turban.
I was eyes to the blind and feet to the lame.
I was a father to the needy, and I defended the rights of the stranger.
I broke the fangs of the wicked and snatched their prey from their teeth.
“Then I thought, ‘I will die in honor after having multiplied my days like grains of sand,[d]
with my roots spreading out to the waters and the dew lying on my branches throughout the night.
My glory will be forever new and the bow in my hand forever strong.’
[e]“Men waited expectantly to hear my words and listened in silence to my counsel.
Once I had spoken, no one spoke further but simply let my thoughts penetrate their minds.
They waited for me as for the rain, with open mouths as though to drink in a spring shower.
“When I smiled at them, they were filled with gratitude, and they were clearly strengthened because of the way I treated them.
As their leader I told them which course to follow, and I lived like a king among his troops, or as a comforter of mourners.
